Abstract: This autobiographical account delves into the career of a clinical psychologist specializing in alcohol use disorder (AUD). The narrative explores the intricate journey from doctoral training to becoming a leading figure in the field. Emphasizing the importance of mentoring, the psychologist reflects on the pivotal role mentors played in shaping their research focus and professional development. The account also highlights the psychologist's contributions to journal editing, underscoring the impact of scholarly dissemination on advancing AUD research. Active involvement in professional societies is discussed as a means of fostering collaboration and advocacy within the scientific community. Through personal anecdotes, the psychologist illustrates the challenges and triumphs encountered while navigating the complexities of studying alcohol-related issues. This narrative not only provides insights into the professional trajectory of a clinical psychologist but also serves as an inspirational guide for emerging researchers dedicated to understanding and addressing alcohol use disorders.
